CatDescriptText: Mr. G. A. Remley, Westinghouse employee and Edward Henderson, restaurant employee, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1962, pg. 6 with question: "Do you think Southerners are sincere in wanting to send Negroes without jobs to the North on Freedom Trains?" Mr. G. A. Remley's answer reads: "They are taking advantage of the uneducated and make life more miserable for them.  They wouldn't be able to get educated persons to take advantage of such offers..."  Edward Henderson's answer reads: "I wouldn't know.  I think it's helping out, however.  That is helping the people."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of G.A. Remley wearing eyeglasses and striped tie with tie bar, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Edward Henderson wearing dark cap, standing in front of Bud Saunders flower shop, Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
